answers.author: Sarah Smith
answers.text:
If you do NOT have such a policy, have you discussed it? Why did you decide not to pursue this?


If you do NOT have such a policy, have you discussed it? Why did you decide not to pursue this?

answers.author: Maxwell Moline
answers.text:
Sarah,
The City of Madison Wisconsin has banned dogs from major city events, due to the dogs' ability to get dehydrated and the tendency for groups of dogs to get into fights and jump at vendors. However, dogs will be allowed in parades. http://www.thedailypage.com/daily/article.php?article=30048
http://host.madison.com/wsj/news/local/govt_and_politics/article_1bab668a-8bbd-11df-bb22-001cc4c03286.html
The City of Winter Park, FL, however, voted on a dog ban that would keep dogs from some parks and events to keep them from eating birds and causing other types of nuisance, and the ban was voted down.
http://www.cfnews13.com/article/news/2010/august/134674/Revised-dog-ordinance-voted-down
Huntington Beach, CA has banned dogs from their boardwalk on Tuesday nights from 5-9, which are known as "Surf City Nights." Normally, the boardwalk is very dog-friendly, though.
http://articles.latimes.com/2009/oct/20/local/me-outthere20
I hope this helps!

author: Sarah Smith
text: Does anyone have a policy banning dogs from public events? If so, could you please provide details of the policy.
title: Dogs and Special Events
